Title: Security Site Supervisor - Unarmed
Description: * *  *   Allied Universal®, North America’s leading security and facility services company, provides rewarding careers that give you a sense of purpose. While working in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive workplace, you will be part of a team that fuels a culture that will reflect in our communities and customers we serve. We offer medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, 401K, employee assistance programs, company discounts, perks and more for all full-time positions!*  *  *    North America’s Leading Security Services Provider is Hiring*  *  *    Security Guard Supervisor*  *  *    Immediate Hiring... Exciting Career in Security Services*  *  *    $19.00/HR Weekly Pay Check, Free Uniform*  *  *    Now Including Daily Pay*  *   *  *  *  Allied Universal Services is seeking the position of a Security Site Supervisor.*   *  The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services to an assigned customer. The Security Site Supervisor will act as a liaison between customers, Operation Managers and security officers. They will supervise site staff and provide coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.*   *  QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:*   Be at least 21 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent*    Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner*   *    *      Licensing requirements are subject to state and/or local laws and regulations and may be required prior to employment.*    *    As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background investigation and a drug screen in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws*    Display exceptional customer service and communication skills*    Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites*    Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently*    Capably utilize scheduling and billing software to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management*    Enforce Contract Standards*    Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures*    Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings*    Enforces Allied Universal’s policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos *   Able to:*     Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat*      Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds*      Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift*      Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time*    *  *    Allied Universal® is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or relationship/association with a protected veteran, or any other basis or characteristic protected by law. For more information: www.aus.com*  *   *  *  *   If you have any questions regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action, Diversity and Inclusion, have difficulty using the online system and require an alternate method to apply, or require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment and/or employment process, please contact our local Human Resources department. To find an office near you, please visit: www.aus.com/offices.*  * *

Title: Lead IT Business Analyst
Description: * Boart Longyear is looking to hire a new Global Payroll Business Systems Lead to support our corporate office in Salt Lake City, UT. Key OTL/Payroll resource responsible for managing global Time and Labor applications, Payroll applications and processes, HR systems and projects including application implementations, application enhancements, process improvements, upgrades, new functionality deployment and systems maintenance. The primary responsibility of this role would be supporting the Oracle Time and Labor (OTL) application globally and integration of OTL with global Payroll applications and Project Accounting. Other duties include maintaining and supporting the HR modules in Oracle Applications and other Global HRIS systems (PDM, Succession Planning, Recruitment, On-Boarding etc.).* Minimum Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree or corresponding work experience.*  Minimum of 7 years of experience with Oracle Time & Labor, Payroll and HR applications.*  A functional professional with at least 2 full lifecycle Oracle HCM implementations.*  Oracle R12 experience.*  Oracle certification is preferred.*  Experience leading and managing a team of system analysts.* Responsibilities: * Lead business process evaluations, requirements gathering, and facilitate project meetings.*  Deliver on assigned tasks in all project phases from initiation, planning, analysis, design, build, test, train, deploy and stabilization.*  Develop project management deliverables such as business requirements, project charter, scope, change management plan and training plan.*  Application setup, application maintenance, system enhancements, process improvements, troubleshooting, production support and end user training.*  Design programs to meet specific business needs including proof of concept, test scenarios and documentation.*  Participate in all aspects of system testing including development of test strategy documentation, write test scripts, coordinate testing resources, compile test completion metrics, and test script execution (including stress tests and user acceptance testing).*  Coordinate and provide inputs to the technical team, and work with managed services and offshore support team to support development and sustainment of Oracle Applications, and aid in bringing the best practice solutions.*  Building the capacity of the business owners to problem solving, analyze the issue, document the issue and resolve the issue.*  Creating, maintaining and monitoring issues and change requests.*  Other duties as needed* SKILLS: * Experience working in Oracle Time and Labor applications and systems.*  Experience working on Global Payroll systems and providers like ADP, Ceridian, PaySpace etc.*  Strong knowledge of ‘Hire to Retire (H2R)’ processes.*  Experience in Oracle HCM modules (Core HR, CWB, OAB, Leave Management, Self-Service etc.).*  Experience in Oracle HCM product integration with third party Payroll applications like ADP, Ceridian etc. is strongly preferred.*  Experience with Core HR functions and systems like Performance Management, On-Boarding, Succession Planning, Benefits Management & Compensation Planning.*  Must have knowledge of Oracle HCM product technical architecture.*  Knowledge of cross-track modules and Oracle HCM integration with Oracle Project Accounting, EAM and Financials is a plus.*  Experience in Oracle Payroll and other third-party Payroll applications is a plus.*  Good knowledge of Oracle AIM and OUM methodologies.*  Strong SQL, PL/SQL, AME experience.*  Experience in training end-users.*  Strong analytical, design, presentation, documentation and reporting skills.*  Excellent problem-solving skills, interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly.*  Demonstrated experience working in an aggressive, fast paced and highly energetic environment.*  Ability to determine root cause of complex problems and working towards for a quicker resolution.*  Strong project management skills with ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple and changing priorities.* Perks, Benefits and Compensation:* We know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture. We also know you want a company that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired you can expect;* Strong compensation plan*  Full medical benefits*  Dental*  Vision*  401K*  Paid Time Off*  Fun and relaxed work environment with all the free coffee you can drink* *All new hires must pass a pre-employment background check and drug test** Boart Longyear does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Boart Longyear does business.* Job Type: Full-time* Benefits:* 401(k)*  401(k) matching*  Dental insurance*  Health insurance*  Paid time off*  Vision insurance* Ability to commute/relocate:* Salt Lake City, UT: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)* Application Question(s):* What is your desired salary?*  Please provide a valis email address.* Education:* Bachelor's (Preferred)* Experience:* Oracle: 4 years (Preferred)*  payroll applications: 3 years (Preferred)* License/Certification:* oracle (Preferred)* Work Location: One location*

Title: IT Business Sr Analyst
Description: * *  The IT Business Senior Analyst is an intermediate-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.Responsibilities:*   Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT*    Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions*    Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information*    Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support*    Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment*    Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned*    Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. *   Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. *   Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.*    Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.*   Qualifications:*  *   5-8 years of relevant experience*    Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills*    Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills*    Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication*    Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships*    Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly*    Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail*   Education:*  *   Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience*  *   -*   Job Family Group: Technology*   -*   Job Family: Business Analysis / Client Services*   -*   Time Type: Full time*   -*   Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.*  *   Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*  *   Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.*  *   View the "EEO is the Law" poster. View the EEO is the Law Supplement.*   View the EEO Policy Statement.*   View the Pay Transparency Posting*   -*   Effective November 1, 2021, Citi requires that all successful applicants for positions located in the United States or Puerto Rico be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and provide proof of such vaccination prior to commencement of employment.* *

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description: The Senior Software Engineer applies practical knowledge of development and engineering to conceive, develop and test, and implement software fixes, enhancements, components, and/or new software systems and applications of moderate to high complexity. The Senior Software Engineer owns development, and drives development of components through your own' and subordinate engineers' work. The Senior Engineer provides technical guidance and acts as a point of escalation and technical expert. The Senior Software Engineer designs and develops highly scalable software systems and applications.Responsibilities :*Own the design and development of software fixes, enhancements, components, and/or new software systems and applications.*Promote development of components through own and subordinate engineers' work.*Develop technical solutions that meet specifications and that impact future developments.*Implement assigned component level software development projects and major fixes using new or existing technologies.*Develop specifications for assigned components, projects or fixes.*Review or write code.*Lead programming, testing and debugging of applications or fixes to existing applications.*Create protocols, documentation and tools for installation and maintenance.*Participate in setting the architectural direction for software development projects.*Design specific components for assigned projects, developing specifications for each.*Design, develop, manage, create and maintain technical components and templates.*Code against front-end technology stack and lead end-to-end troubleshooting.*Interacts and coordinates deliverables with other technical groups in the organization.*Execute assigned component level projects using all technologies*Design and develop specifications for assigned projects*Reviews or troubleshoots and performs testing.*Participate in conceiving and setting the architectural direction for development projects.*Design the component tasks of assigned projects, developing specifications for each*Serve as a high level technical resource and "go-to" person for less experienced developers, providing technical guidance and oversight.*Lead team members in problem analysis and issue resolution.*Recommend improvements to processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of the team.*Basic Qualifications :*5+ years of progressively related experience in design, development, and implementation of highly scalable, high-volume software systems and components, client-facing web applications, and major Internet-oriented applications and systems.*Scrum Master Certification.*ITIL Certification.*Significant knowledge/experience in relevant technologies, such as:*CS Fundamentals*Development Tools*Java/JavaScript*SQL*XML DTDs*JSON Messaging*Database Design*HTTP Protocol*Web Services (SOAP & REST)*HTML/XHTML/DHTML*CSS*Ruby, Python, PHP, JSP, ASP or other scripting languages*Flash and other interactive technologies*Software Performance Optimization (memory, CPU, scaling, etc...)*Required Education :*Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar field or related work experience.*Additional Information :**#DISNEYTECH*#DPEPFLA*#LI-JB4

Title: Product Manager – Data Science & Engineering
Description: As a Product Manager with Disney Parks, Experience and Products (DPEP), you will build backlogs and roadmaps for the use of data, data science and analytics across Disney's Parks, Resorts and Consumer Products businesses. You will use your knowledge of data, deep understanding of business domains to develop and prioritize user stories for development by our engineering teams. You will assure that data products exceed expectations by working with users and through measurement of measurements.Responsibilities :*Manage data products and serve as the subject matter expert and "voice of the market"*Be accountable for the vision, market strategy, design, implementation, and sustainment of data products*Prioritize and manage the product backlog*Work with scrum masters and Agile teams to ensure user stories meet the definition of ready and definition of done*Develop and track progress against a product roadmap to build enhancing capabilities over time*Develop new product ideas and data use cases, and advocate for using data and advanced analytics inside and outside the organization*Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs)*Collaborate with managers to align on product strategy and technical feasibility*Understand market needs for using data and analytics*Balance commercial, technical, operational, and strategic issues to inform product improvements*Manage impediments and problems, resolve issues, and fix broken processes*Lead change management efforts for projects with key and impacted stakeholders*Be open to feedback from the development teams and willing to provide feedback*Participate in Agile ceremonies*Align with other product managers when needed from an overall product, organization, or Guest perspective*Manage business/technical partner relationships, advocating for needs and best interests of those partners*Basic Qualifications :*Relevant Product Management work experience*Experience with data, data science, analytics, and business intelligence*Develop deep business expertise and provide thought partnership around the use of data to solve problems and drive improvements*Perform across multiple phases of development for complex projects, from ideation to deployment*Passionate about delivering data science and engineering projects and features in a team environment*Strong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills, including story-telling, relationship-building, influence and negotiation*Required Education :*Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field OR equivalent work experience*Additional Information :**#DISNEYTECH*#DPEPFLA*#LI-JB4

Title: Statistical Programmer II - Remote
Description: Come join the Parexel Statistical Programmer team today!**The Statistical Programmer II provides technical expertise for the conduct of clinical trials, and works with*minimal supervision to support various programming activities related to the analysis and reporting of*clinical study data. In addition, the Statistical Programmer II may fill the Statistical Programming Lead role*(or part of that role) on small, non-complex projects. Qualifications Qualifications:*Excellent analytical skills.*Proficiency in SAS.*Knowledge and understanding of the programming and reporting process.*Knowledge of SOPs/Guidelines, ICH-GCP, and any other applicable local and international**regulations such as 21 CFR Part 11.*Ability to learn new systems and function in an evolving technical environment.*Ability to manage competing priorities and flexibility to change.*Attention to detail.*Ability to successfully work as part of a global team.*Work effectively in a quality-focused environment.*Effective time management in order to meet daily metrics or team objectives.*Show commitment to and perform consistently high quality work.*Business/operational skills that include customer focus, commitment to quality management, and**problem solving.*Knowledge and Experience:Competent in written and oral English.*Good communication skills.*Education:Educated to degree level in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent work experience. EEO Disclaimer Parexel is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, which in the US includes race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.*

Title: Principal Statistical Programmer - Remote
Location: Remote in Bingham Canyon, UT 84006+9 locations
Description: Be part of our empowered Parexel Statistical Programming team today!**As a Principal Programmer you will be recognized as a subject matter expert, providing technical support and expert advice to internal and external sponsors. Parexel will provide you with the perfect opportunity to expand on your experiences and develop new skills in a stimulating work environment**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES include (not an exhaustive list of duties):**Input into and negotiate statistical programming timelines.*Ensure that timelines are adhered to coordinate and lead a statistical programming team to successful completion of a study within given timelines and budget*Monitor project resourcing, project budgets, and identify changes in scope*Ensure quality control (QC) on all process and technical activities related to derived dataset, table, listing, and figure programming in accordance with corporate quality standards*Maintain all supporting documentation for studies in accordance with WSOPs/Guidelines to ensure traceability and regulatory compliance*Provide a broad range of leadership and influencing capabilities to achieve the business objectives and goals for both Parexel and sponsors*Provide leadership, project specific training, stakeholder management, external sponsor support, resource management, and project management for the required programming tasks supporting clinical trial activities Skills**Proficiency in SAS*Knowledge of the programming and reporting process*Knowledge of WSOPs/Guidelines/System Life Cycle methodologies, ICH-GCP and any other applicable local and international regulations such as 21 CFR Part 11 and proven practical application*Strong leadership skills*Ability to successfully work together with a (“virtual”) team (including international teams as required) as well as independently*Excellent analytical skills*Effective time management in order to meet daily metrics or team objectives Qualifications Education*Educated to degree level in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent work experience*Language Skills*Excellent communication skills both verbal and written*Required skills and experience:*7+ years proficiency in SAS programming*2+ years of ADaM, CDISC or SDTM*Lead experience in a Pharma setting*Attention to detail, ability to be self-driven and solid organization skills*Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) EEO Disclaimer Parexel is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, which in the US includes race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Renewables Lead SCADA/EMS Engineer, Energy Storage - REMOTE
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT
Description: * Lead Energy Storage SCADA/EMS Engineer - RenewablesLocation: FULL TIME REMOTE (Anywhere in the USA)* This an opportunity to join an industry leading renewable energy venture with strong private equity backing that is focused on the development and execution of dynamic utility-scale energy storage projects. They are at the forefront of the industry, have accumulated over 7GW of projects in a relatively short period of time, and are currently in an accelerated expansion phase that includes the addition of a Lead SCADA/EMS Controls Engineer.* This is a business critical role that will help drive the Asset Management strategy in the areas of SCADA, EMS, and Automated Control Systems across the portfolio. It is a hands-on role that will act as a Lead SCADA/EMS Engineer in the development of control system architecture and methodologies for innovative utility-scale renewable energy projects involving battery storage technology.* They are committed to creating more renewable infrastructure solutions for the grid and are offering long term EQUITY BASED BONUS INCENTIVES OPPORTUNITIES to their employees leading the drive to meet company goals. Other perks included a competitive base salary, open PTO policy, flex work hours, benefits, the opportunity to work with a transparent Executive Leadership Team..and more.* RESPONSIBILITIES: * Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Acts as an SME for all EMS and SCADA implementation, installation, commissioning and maintenance energy storage initiatives*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Takes ownership of new Energy Management System integrations, algorithms, network models, and conceptual design build outs based on ISO/RTO requirements*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Leads SCADA and substation automation system integration process*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Develops and implements a EMS/SCADA operating procedures that meet ISO/RTO and NERC compliance standards*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Provides technical assessments of grid-tied inverter software and hardware solutions*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Evaluates battery storage dispatch models, battery management systems, inverters, P&C layouts, and relay logic to ensure assets are optimized for success*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Manages interconnection network infrastructure (substation, t-line, generation plants..etc) requirements based on incoming load requests and transmission interconnection agreements*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Executes any necessary power system studies, power quality, electrical control system simulations*  Lead Energy Storage SCADA Engineer / Control Systems Engineer - Leads business critical stakeholder correspondence with Renewable Developers, Regulatory bodies, ISOs, and internal partners* QUALIFICATIONS: * Bachelors Degree in Engineering or related discipline with a focus EMS (Energy Management Systems) and SCADA*  Hands-on experience with inverter system controls, dispatch modeling systems, battery storage, or renewable energy/electric utility control system integration protocols*  Ability to build out NEW EMS infrastructure and back end SCADA communication systems for control center optimization*  Well versed in writing/defining SCADA / EMS operational scopes, conceptual design, and defining technical requirements*  Proven background in ISO/RTO and transmission interconnection stakeholder management including assessing grid impacts and necessary infrastructure substation, t-line, generation plants..etc) support*  Strong understanding of SCADA, State Estimation, Real-time Contingency Analysis, Dispatcher Power Flow, Operator Training Simulator (OTS), User Interface, Automatic Generation Control, and Data Alarm Processing* Job Type: Full-time* Pay: $120,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year* Benefits:* 401(k)*  Flexible schedule*  Health insurance*  Paid time off*  Parental leave* Schedule:* Monday to Friday* Supplemental Pay:* Bonus pay* Work Location: Multiple Locations*

Title: Senior Network Engineer
Description: * *  BASIC FUNCTION OF POSITION*   Manages local area networks, wide area networks, wireless networks, and all the connectivity components associated with each service. Responsible for the design, configuration, installation, and maintenance of all network related physical and virtual equipment both on premise and in the cloud. Work closely with other division members to ensure connectivity redundancy in service areas. Responsible for directing and maintaining network security both on premise and in the cloud.*   SUPERVISION RECEIVED*   The Senior Network Engineer works under the supervision and direction of the Information Technology Manager.*   SUPERVISION EXERCISED*   None.*   PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES*   The following list describes several of the essential functions of this position. This list may be supplemented as necessary:*   Provides advanced core routing, switching, wireless, and unified communications infrastructure support.*    Manages the core networks and associated components including design, installation, configuration, maintenance, support, and security.*    Assesses network support needs; develops and promotes effective solutions.*    Analyzes network functions and evaluates the services provided; develops project plans to take action and recommend improvements; identifies milestones and issues to be addressed and generates reports.*    Supports and maintains core data center networks that support virtualization, automation, and cloud networking solutions to enhance rapid deployment of infrastructure resources.*    Ensures reliable enterprise system operation by applying security updates and following security configuration standards and best practices.*    Works with external partner engineering and management teams on project technical requirements and support/design issues.*    Monitors utilization trends and manages network performance to assure maximum uptime; performs ongoing analysis, capacity planning, and technical tuning of the network to improve performance and identify potential issues for future design improvements.*    Implements network performance and security monitoring tools to proactively monitor and alert for network performance and security issues.*    Designs, configures, and maintains network components; troubleshoots network to diagnose system problems; identifies, locates, resolves, and repairs problems; installs and configures software*    Stays current on emerging technologies via professional groups, trade magazines, internal and external training, independent research and study, and other avenues available.*    Provides 24/7 on-call response on an ongoing rotational basis*    Performs other duties of a similar nature or level as assigned.*   TYPICAL DECISIONS*   Decisions are technical in nature and require significant knowledge and analytic thought. Decisions often have impact across the organization. Work in this position requires collaborative and independence professional decision-making. Decisions may involve confidential information.*   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES*   Knowledge and Skills *  Expert level network design, installation, configuration, and maintenance of large-scale network infrastructure (e.g., LAN, WAN, Wireless, VPN, Switching, Firewall, QoS, DNS, Layer-2 and Layer-3). *   Hardware equipment (e.g., routers, switches, cables and cabling standards, and network monitoring and troubleshooting tools, etc.) *   Networks consisting primarily of Network Access/Distribution/Core routers and switches, data center equipment, WAN, LAN, VLAN WLAN, Wireless Access Points and Wireless controllers*    Carrier provided circuits T1, PRI, SIP Trunks, DS3, Metropolitan Optical Ethernet and OC12.*    EIA/TIA cabling standards (568A, 568B)*    Network and host-based security, 802.1x, incident response, disaster recovery, firewall and VPN management and administration*    Expert level application transport and network infrastructure protocols (i.e., SSL/TLS, DNS, DHCP, WINS, NTP, FTP, HTTP(S), SMTP, CIFS, LDAP, IEEE 802.11 Wireless and Microsoft AD) and how to support these applications/protocols when accessed through VPN and firewall appliances*    Expert level static routing and routing protocols (i.e., RIP, OSPF, and BGP) and WAN technologies (i.e., MPLS)*    AAA technologies (RADIUS, TACACS, 802.1X, MAC address authentication, and Web authentication)*    Assist in the proper configuration of Windows OS, Linux, HPE Aruba, Cisco IOS, Palo Alto, Fortinet, and other network equipment.*    Assist in the proper configuration of Cloud solutions, such as Microsoft Azure.*   Ability to*   Set up the interaction between networks, utilized by peripherals and communications equipment (desktops, laptops, printers, monitors, scanners, phones, servers, etc.) *   Design, manage, and troubleshoot software tools (i.e., NetScout, Aruba Network Management, Provisioning Manger, Fluke, WireShark, LAN Management Software, VMWare, Visio, Solarwinds, Airmagnet) *   Work closely and effectively with your supervisor*    Communicate effectively, clearly, and concisely to convey technical information to the County's business community*    Approach a problem through a logical, systematic, and sequential process. Think logically and systematically; solve complex problems; effectively apply general principles to specific conditions*    Facilitate projects and meetings as assigned*    Work effectively with all levels of the organization*    Analyze business and technical processes and determine ways of making them more efficient*    Remain calm under stress and quickly adjust, evolve, and multi-task between several competing priorities at once*    Maintain confidentiality and professionalism*   MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:*   Graduation from a nationally accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or closely related field plus five or more (5+) years of experience with directly related network experience in a similar environment or size and scope, or an equivalent combination of related education and experience.*    Valid Utah Driver's License.*    Successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening test.*   DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS*   Network engineering in a similar environment, size and scope.*    Troubleshooting and testing of systems.*    Evidence of advanced networking coursework or experience.*    Additional preference may be given to candidates who also have experience with video teleconferencing systems, microwave radio systems, or satellite communication systems; Federal, State, and local regulations concerning the installation, operation,*   WORKING ENVIRONMENT*   The work performed by the successful applicant will be regularly performed in a general office environment during routine office hours. However, some duties will be performed in partially environmentally controlled rooms but in a very noisy environment. In addition, the work performed:*   will occasionally expose the successful applicant to conditions such as fumes, noxious odors, dust, mists, gases, poor ventilation, and other hazardous chemicals.*    will occasionally expose the successful applicant to possible bodily injury from moving mechanical parts of equipment, tools, or machinery.*    will include sustained periods outdoors, and occasionally in hot, cold, or inclement weather.*    will require the use of protective devices such as masks, goggles, and gloves.*    will frequently expose the successful applicant to possible bodily injury from exposure to high power radio frequency emissions and possible bodily injury from electrocution hazard when working near power lines.*   PHYSICAL AND MENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS*   To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of the essential job functions satisfactorily. This position involves periods of prolonged sitting or standing and use of computer equipment. The successful applicant will also be required to bend, kneel, stoop and stand for extended periods of time to perform job duties and will frequently be required to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects weighing up to 60 pounds, and occasionally up to 100 pounds (i.e. radio repeaters, duplexers, antennas, combiners and other test equipment). In addition, the successful applicant will also be required to ascend and descend ladders, scaffolding, ramps, poles, high towers, and the like; use tools or equipment requiring a high degree of dexterity; walk, stand, or crouch on narrow, slippery, or erratically moving surfaces and regularly drive a motor vehicle to report to various job sites or to various locations to purchase or pick-up housed equipment.*   UFA Employment Status Category: Nonexempt* *

Title: Senior Flex Circuit R&D Engineer (UT)
Description: Flex Circuit R&D Engineer**Education & Experience Level:*A minimum of 8+ years of Flex PCB design, development, test, and manufacturing experience**A minimum of Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Electrical, Materials Science, Mechanical)*Key responsibilities in this role include:*Own all aspects of ultra-thin Flex PCB design while working alongside electrical and mechanical hardware design engineers and PCB fabrication & assembly vendors**Design flex layouts, prototyping and modeling, testing and verification, and process development prior to being manufacturing ready.**Support continued vendor, manufacturing, and quality control efforts tied to the flex circuits and flex circuit assemblies once components and assemblies are qualified and products are releases.**Prepare fabrication notes, assembly notes, and all deliverables, such as Gerber files, PCB assembly BOMs, and other Flex PCB and assembly related documents required by fabrication vendors to build flexible circuit boards for prototypes and products.**Work within an FDA regulated industry with the understanding of proper design controls methodologies.*Work with local and international Flex fabrication vendors and contract manufacturers for addressing DFM concerns and providing feedback**Develop electrical and electro-mechanical test methods to evaluate flex circuits during prototyping, simulated use, and manufacturing along with post use and for failure analysis.**Maintain technical coordination within Engineering, products design, test, EMC engineering and manufacturing**Resolve design and build issues with fabrication and assembly vendors**Work with vendors to push the limits of fabrication capabilities*Contribute to the design and develop some of the world's smallest most innovative medical devices.**Key Qualifications:*Knowledge of ultra-thin flexible PCB Design, stack-up, materials, understanding of flex technology and processing of layers down in the microns.**Experience working with ultra-thin flex fabrication and assembly vendors*Familiarity with new and established technologies in mounting and isolation of ultra-small components onto flexible circuits**Experience and knowledge of IPC standards and practices.**Experience with layout of analog and digital circuits with understanding of shielding techniques.**Ability to prepare artwork, such as Gerbers, for fabrication of PCBs**Ability to work independently and in a team to determine flex PCB stack-up, design constraints, mounting and component bonding methods, signal routing, material interactions, process development for integration, and design for manufacturability for both PCB assembly and integration into devices.*Proven track record of managing all aspects of PCB design and development**Ability to travel to vendors and manufacturing facilities as needed.*Supervision:*Must thrive with limited supervision. Must be able to identify and manage priorities, problem solve, and provide clear/concise technical and schedule updates.**This role is for an individual contributor with strong technical and project leadership abilities.
